Marble veining is one of favourite new trends! The dramatic patterns  create so much depth. We added the Tom Dixon Form tea set to the kitchen countertop at our Chelsea Project and we love the result.

Digital detoxes are gaining momentum and for good reason. I, for one, sometimes feel glued to my phone and laptop, often unable to dedicate quality time to mental and physical restoration. To ring in the new year I opted for some much needed Winter sun in my safe place, Dubai. I loved nothing more than watching my son abandon his tech for the day, in favour of swimming in the sea and playing bat and ball with homesoneltd on the beach. 
 
Dubai has become a global hub for design and designers. It’s far more than just a holiday, for me, it’s time for exploration and inspiration too. I truly value the important interdependence of culture and design in this global melting pot. The ongoing evolution of a UAE design aesthetic relies on marrying traditional and modern elements from the Emirates and this hugely influences much of my creative drive. 

I’ve returned to London bursting with ideas. Experimenting with materials and fusing craft with indigenous materials and rethinking the regular: Arabic motifs, style and colour. The year of 2023 will see Atelier NM pushing creative boundaries even further. I’m excited.

•

A second glimpse at a concept design we have been working on for a development project in London. 
 
The bedrooms were designed with unmistakable character, governed by a curation of light, space and energy. A metamorphosis of materials, finishes and colour, and I’m just obsessed with the ombre plaster finish behind the headboard.

Sustainability has been a crucial consideration - no longer a buzzword, rather a conscious mindset and a lifestyle choice. We believe designing in this way is the best expression of luxury and low impact living in tune with nature. This is the new marker of how we view luxury in our eco-friendly and health-conscious society.

I’ve seen a huge pivot to a this way of working across the industry, catering to our clients’ ethical values, especially within residential developments. As a studio, we’ll continue to explore and work with ethical suppliers to ensure that quality and beautiful interiors can exist in harmony with nature.

.

“Colour is the place where our brain and universe meet.” ~ Paul Klee
 
Never not loving a colourful tile, especially in a hallway. Our most recent project captures the raw Maltese culture, both vivid and mesmerising!
 
These 100 year old handcrafted tiles bring out the most beautiful features in this restored Maltese house for our very stylish private client. We were really thoughtful about every detail and corner of this property which is steeped in history. Preserving the original tiles and a lot of existing architecture was key and we were delighted to be invited to contribute against such amazing original backdrop, well preserved by architect @fawzi_azar. I think the colours are just so lovely and a great homage to both the locality and family vibe...

“Digital Lavender” has officially been named by trend forecasting @WSGN and @coloro_ as  2023’s colour of the year and it’s full of hope and positivity!
 
There’s something so pure about this lavender hue with spiritual references rooting from Sahasrara or the ‘Crown Chakra’ which is purple, a colour significantly connected to spirituality and it’s already popped up in our recent planning and design sessions. It’s a shade that poses that much-needed optimism and escapism that I am craving; it is imaginative and creative but also speaks of serenity and balance.

The staircase is often a transition space, used to get from one floor to another. Focussing on staircase ideas is a key part of planning and design at Atelier NM. After all, in a traditional multi-level home, the staircase is often smack bang in the middle. Why not make it an architectural wonder, a statement, a piece of the decor that sets the tone for the overall scheme?
 
We are obsessed with the most beautiful and original features that were retained wonderfully by @fawzi_azar for our client’s magnificent family home.

Blast from the past!
 
I’ve found myself so drawn towards the 1970s era recently. In an age where we are still seeing all-white kitchens and greige living rooms, my hue combinations seem to be edging towards the 1970s palette, or as I like to call it the Wes Anderson ambiance. Avocado greens, ochre yellows and musty-dusty blues with simple shapes and raw materials. To me this evokes a delicate balance of earth tones with playful colour that doesn’t tread into the tacky. It’s cool, it’s calming, and it’s…very ’70s. And I love mushroom shaped lamps!

With an enviable setting, this beautiful house combines pared-back minimalism with total tranquillity. A paradigm of simplicity with an injection of vibrant, Maltese traditional colour.
 
I wanted to preserve the beautiful traditional elements of this traditional Maltese home. We used a palette of muted natural colours, a mix of tiles and micro-cement for the flooring and wall, and natural panelling. These natural materials honour not only the region but also the landscape and make this elegant and majestic house both luxurious and practical. The interiors are strong, beautiful, and not in the least pretentious. The furniture selected reflects a maltese culture, colours and minmalism - it is the thread that runs through the home. 

We chose the Floren Pendant from @CTOlighting as homage to the arts and craft movement, a nod to both creativity and opulance. The ribbed glass diffuses light beautifully through the space. The sofa is bespoke, sitting atop a solid antique brass base.

Coming up easy!

“It was in love I was created. And in love is how I hope I die.” ~ Paolo Nutini
 
People have become increasingly interested in interiors and decorating a home is a way to let your personality and point of view shine. My home is adorned with treasures collected over the years.

All aspects of my life are connected, and I want to live and work in the same place and show people that art and design can be part of daily life, to truly express my passions and personality. It taps into something more interesting and layered.
 
This is a snapshot of my bedroom, the backdrop for such a beautiful commission by artist @livogart. Liv is fascinated by the arabic motifs, mythology and other forms of historical works that have patterns and archetypes. I am in love with everything she produces!

The tallest mass-timber building in London. The Black & White Building is aimed at setting a precedent in sustainable office design. I’ve been following the construction progress of this building where the outside really does flow into the internals too. 

The interior design has been devised by @daytripstudio and incredibly embrace the use of wood. The motivation behind the design is to encourage social connection and wellbeing.The ‘furry’ chequered floor tiles are a bit of me and I’m so drawn to the playful narrative that has been thoughtfully woven throughout. Bravo!

When I was a kid I thought kitchen nooks with banquettes were the absolute coolest and I still do as an adult 🤩
 
We designed this banquette dining nook where the old reclaimed leather-meets-the contemporary, which I adore. I love a client with great taste, and the choice of leather was exactly this, and when paired with the deep, dark green it brings such a fresh and distinctive feel to the space. I think banquette seating is very underrated in residential homes. It really is a great use of space and a glorious corner in which to start and end the day...

A lofty nook which is very connected to the outdoors. @jesseparrislamb cleverly added a wrap-around window which now peers into the lush greenery of the garden. Bravo!
 
This is such a great example of how a design and creative team should approach a project – elevating out of the ordinary. The window was inspired by the observation windows found on 20th-century passenger trains which is a subtle nod to the era in which the house was built, and helps create a seamless transition between the dining room and the adjacent garden.

Very excited to unveil a recent design concept we have been working on for an iconic London residential development scheme. We wanted bring together female-focused artistry, thoughtful design and refences to the locality.
 
Cinematic Escapism; the tendency to seek distraction and relief from day to day realities, especially by seeking entertainment or engaging in fantasy. 
 
There is a lot of unique history and heritage behind this scheme with the area drawing many influences from the Art Deco era. The theme draws on historical cinematic references mixing nostalgic touches with contemporary finishes. Easy to maintain whilst visually captivating. We took a softer take on the Art Deco’s key tones and themes; luxurious but simultaneously cosseting. With sustainability at the forefront, the link to the natural world is prevalent creating a sense of well-being and connection to the outside landscape. 
 
First impressions are everything and we just love the squiggle-shape custom chandelier that crowns the space complimented by a flow of natural light using ribbed glass arches. The sculptural space, with pieces linked to escapism and the empowerment of women, combines a stellar collection of contemporary art and moments of striking architecture.

Inspired by the ebb and flow of the natural world and a journey of organic luxury where the importance of positive energy is apparent. One Clapham Junction is a space where understated richness and opulence thrives.
Colour change and process is par for the course in and around The Junction as part of the Industrial Revolution. Steel and its transformation throughout the eras forms part of our design DNA for this project and the bespoke cabinet in the Living Room pays homage to this malleable metal and the colour journey it moves through during the burning process. A real statement piece.

There has been a huge shift in terms of reshaping the core of our residential development schemes. 

Creating homes that have a true identity and a base specification that feels bespoke but durable…and stands the test of time.
 
Increasingly, new developments have to adapt to trends both within the property world and wider society. These changes can impact the materials chosen, functionality and spatial layouts. A new type of resident is entering the new-build market attracted to the lifestyle it provides and all the amenities it offers. 

Developers are starting to turn their attention to investing both time and energy in fresh perspectives for the design and development, challenging norms and raising the bar. It’s such an exciting space to be moving and shaking in right now….

Perhaps the most un-Dubai hotel of all Dubai hotels.
 
25Hours Hotel has this sleek vibe that’s really beginning to permeate the city itself. Edgy, design-forward and breaking boundaries without being too polished with a playful dose of Euro cool. There is a great sense of exploration and I love this renaissance of a once dreary area of Dubai.
 
I really think this is such a great a journey for Dubai. Moving away from the spotlighted glitz and glamour to a more ‘realism’ vibe - incredibly unique, quirky, nostalgic, fast-paced, inclusive, open to change, more authentic, and full of surprises design and mindset.
 
Truly showcasing a new wave of fearlessness juxtaposed against a continent where traditionality reigns supreme.

Refract is a resin furniture collection created in collaboration with @sp01design and @spacefurniture. 

From a custom designed surfboard to a perfectly formed coffee table, there’s an interesting parallel in the way that light interacts with this material as sunlight does with seawater. Magical and ethereal!
 
Resin furniture is a blend of delicate craftsmanship and linear minimalism, it’s the distinct materiality that plays the leading role in shape, opacity, and colour selection – this may be the one instance in our current culture when something plastic is being celebrated rather than criticized.

Office inspo at its finest….

Although feminism has (almost) overcome the shackles of the housewife’s kitchen imagery, the aesthetic codes of that era persist. The kitschy pastel shades of the fifties and sixties are now paraded in some designers’ best work and you’ll usually see these pop up in many Atelier NM projects. One of my favourite things to do is look back, re-use, recycle when it comes to colour plaettes. This era really sings of retro aesthetics which can juggle with moods so well.
 
I’m also always soaking up creative cues during my down time in the evenings. The pop years and the old school palette are hovering over fashion in a hyper couture version. The pink Prada suit worn by Austin Butler in the latest Elvis Presley biopic is already iconic. So are the argyle tunics from Casablanca, inspired by the popular wardrobe of the golden age of rock’n’roll.
 
Such a very special era.

Sometimes the Land of Nod is a tricky place to get to. Wouldn’t it be brilliant if we could sleep as well as that neighbourhood cat who doses on a fence while a hydraulic drill digs up the pavement? 
 
Good sleep is essential for health.  Just because sleep is a natural behaviour does not mean that it should be taken for granted. Sleeping is a necessary common denominator, and so we should prioritise keeping our sleep spaces.
 
I use design to play on the collective experience of sleep and a ‘a slower pace of existence’. Anything that helps keep the space as clear and pollutant-free as possible - we call it electro-smog. From our screens to the plugs in our bedrooms, we are surrounded by electro-smog.
 
Here is a peak of one of the bedrooms from our palace gate project. The son of my client really reflects the vibes in this room; he is such a serene guy and talking to him is actually super easy and comforting. 
 
Thank you @kassavello for the most beautiful headboard and my favourite fabric  house in the world, @lelievreparis.

A surefire way to add some pep to your step, Jerica Christensen brings the fun with this vibrant show stopper staircase rug, bursting with colour and boasting a delightfully whimsical ‘dripping’ shape.

Hovering over the headboard, wall plates by Sofia of Enjoy Thinking serve as a captivating centrepiece. Crafted with love and steeped in tradition, these unique treasures transform the room into a personal gallery of Greek charm.

Design inspiration is all around, often in the most unexpected forms. The AMOUAGE chair by LRNCE is one such gem. Its Hay Pantone shade is an embodiment of tranquillity, a hue that stirs up images of sun-dappled afternoons in Marrakech.

In Atelier NM’s design universe, pieces like AMOUAGE serve as anchor points, adding texture, character and a splash of ‘quirk’ to our spaces.
Interior design isn’t just about the aesthetic, it’s about capturing personality. And this bathroom? It has plenty to spare.

Ever found inspiration in a bold blue hue, a soft pastel grey, or the unexpected twist of a lemon-yellowbar counter? Then step right into the Lisa Says Gah boutique. It’s a colour-filled treat for your senses, whipped up by the uber-creative, Adi Goodrich.

With a playful nod to San Francisco’s iconic Golden Gate, the boutique is a canvas for Liana Jegers’ illustrations, bringing a dash of artful mystery. It’s a kaleidoscope of colours, textures, and innovative design - your go-to recipe for any space that dares to be different.

We've danced our way into the Top 50 Interior Designers list again for 2023! 

A big thanks to @countryandtownhouse and our fabulous clients who let us play with colours and textures in their sacred spaces. And an air-kiss to the artisans who add their magic to our madness.🏆

Each tiny detail, whether a sleek picture frame or an artisan-crafted vase, has a part to play. Handpicked with care, decorative elements infuse character and depth into a room, turning it from just a ‘space’ to a dynamic storytelling stage.

We’re not just designing a room but narrating a tale. Each piece and detail is a character in our narrative, and we ensure that they all play their part to perfection.

By marrying contemporary and vintage art with furniture and sculptures from renowned and rising artists, Kelly Wearstler created a design language for this project that is unapologetically unique. It’s a celebration of her clients’ personal tastes, framed within an open layout that invites exploration and discovery.

🖌 @kellywearstler

Not every concept gets to strut its stuff in the limelight, but hey, they’re still rockstars of inspiration. In this one, we’ve mixed the mellow with the zesty, the classic with the contemporary, creating a haven that’s equal parts peaceful and perky.

Picture a retreat with a sweeping curtain wall and a fluted bedhead, a bold idea that crafts a personal oasis. The plot thickens as pendant wall lights peep through the curtain joints, casting a captivating aura.

Up the voltage with a dash of neon artwork, a show-stopper that’s all about pizazz. We’ve got function and form shaking hands in the form of a dual-purpose dressing table/workstation, all clean lines and minimalist chic.

Capping it off is an arched mirror with a hint of yesteryears, adding a sprinkle of vintage charm amidst modern sophistication. At Atelier NM, we’re all about crafting narratives, one room at a time.

The blend of pastel green with striking green marble creates a sensory delight, a testament to the power of colour and texture. 

This space, part of a Long Island House renovation project by Marianna Fiorin Interiors, is a celebration of subtle elegance and refined craftsmanship.

A hallway that redefines the first impressions and a space that perfectly epitomises Atelier NM’s ethos, where timeless charm coalesces with bold, contemporary statements.

The home resonates with a fearless approach to colour, texture, and form - it’s a place where traditional norms are broken and replaced with an individualistic and unique style.

Colourful Roman mornings are best enjoyed at the mesmerizing @villa_medici. @indiamahdavi’s artistry marries colour and geometry, breathing a magical atmosphere and dynamic dimensions into six historic rooms. A design revelation, engaging your imagination in the most unexpected ways!

Our approach at the beautifully curated Chelsea Barracks’ Whistler Square: minimalism meets metallic magic. It’s through such details, and the careful preservation of original features, that we create a truly engaging dialogue between past and present.

Welcome to my very own wonderland - my home at Ravenscourt Park. Drifting amongst clouds illustrated on the wallpaper, the space is brought down to earth with touches of bronze and blush pink. A place where imagination takes flight and dreams become design.

In June 2021, we breathed new life into a family home full of personality. Embracing original features and the needs of a young family, we infused bold patterns, statement lighting, and a colour palette that sings—a home where heritage meets fun.
Reimagining a space, enhancing functionality, and highlighting a collection of art was our task for this spacious property. The result? A vibrant canvas for the owners’ quirky objets d’art.
Colourful buildings kissing the Mediterranean Sea - a visual feast that fuels the creative soul. Holiday memories are etched in hues of joy!

Exploring the Tuscan dream in Montalcino.

As an interior designer, I’m constantly inspired by this region’s timeless elegance and rustic charm.Every corner, every vineyard, tells a story waiting to be woven into a design. Here’s a snapshot from my Italian escapade because sometimes, the best inspiration comes from nature and history combined.

Ciao from Tuscany!

Dive deep into the layered charm of one of Montecito’s finest by @houseofhoney. Artsy wallpapers, calm corners, and a sprinkle of unexpected moments—Tamara Kaye-Honey sure gives each space a distinct feel. It’s like an evolving story where each room is a chapter.

In our Palace Gate project, the continuity from the dining space, with its sumptuous marble shine, to the calm ambience of light-blue cabinets creates a fluid narrative. The curated wall art is climactic, ensuring the eyes are drawn through the entire area.

In every detail of our Chelsea Barracks project, the artistry of skilled craftspeople shines through, from the curated brass accents that imbue the space with warmth to the carefully chosen books and candles that serve both function and aesthetics. The styling process here is far from incidental—it’s a meticulous blend of art and science, where each piece contributes to a harmonious whole. It’s a testament to the thoughtful curation that marks all our projects, encapsulating the enduring principles of design.

Talk about innovation! Hassan Ragab is shaking up the scene, combining age-old Mediterranean vibes with cutting-edge AI in his designs. With tools like Midjourney, he’s crafting spaces that bridge the old and the new in the most stylish way, like in this bathroom from another world. If you’re yet to discover him, browse where inspiration awaits.

In interiors, light and shadow are paramount. Our Malta project celebrates this with its luminous white walls, drawing you into the embrace of a natural wood staircase. 

The spirited colours of the original tiles act as punctuations, showcasing that sometimes, contrasts hold the key to visual harmony.

Finding inspiration isn’t just about looking; it’s about truly seeing. The architectural nuances of Marrakesh, from its ornate carvings to its colour palettes, act as a masterclass in holistic design. As designers, it reminds us that genuine artistry often lies in details and the stories they tell.

My sanctuary highlights a golden rule of design: materials matter. The brass kitchen cabinets intriguingly play with light, their reflections, juxtaposed with the grounding black oven and clean white tiles, showcase the power of a balanced palette.

If there was ever a sink that could steal the show, it’s this bright pink wonder by @amyexton. A fearless choice that’s got us thinking of all the design possibilities! And a quick shoutout: if you find yourself in the UK, don’t miss her vibrant @margatelocationhouse.

There’s a fine line between audacious and elegant. This blend of gold and black animal print dances on that edge; that’s why I love it. While it’s unapologetically bold, its incorporation exemplifies that risk, when calculated, can lead to remarkable design revelations.

Explore the eclectic charm of @jorgepardosculpture’s home in Merida. It’s a riot of colour, where every nook feels like a curated piece of art. It’s a design lover’s playground between vibrant hues and standout artwork.

Hi lovely new followers!

I’m Najwa, the heart and soul behind Atelier NM. I wanted to step out from behind the curtain and share a little about my journey and ethos.

Our surroundings are an extension of ourselves, a canvas on which our memories, experiences, and dreams come to life. That’s why I pour my heart into understanding spaces and the people who inhabit them. Designing for me isn’t just aesthetics; it’s about weaving together stories, memories, and emotions to create a space that feels just right.

Over the years, I’ve been fortunate to collaborate with brilliant minds, explore diverse cultures, and dive deep into the intricate tapestry of design. Every project, big or small, teaches me something new and reinforces my love for this craft.

I’m excited to share more insights, projects, and behind-the-scenes glimpses with all of you. Here’s to more beautiful spaces, shared stories, and a future filled with design that touches the soul.

Warmly, Najwa

The Palace Gate bed is a harmonious blend of pastels and jewel tones. It captures a confident femininity, elevated by the unique scalloped bed frame. It is a perfect combination of grace and vibrancy.

Entertaining becomes a visual feast in this Beverly Gardens kitchen seating area. Bright and refreshing, every gathering here feels like a celebration. The bronze details add depth and warmth, while the gallery wall is a curated canvas of memories and art.

Italy is more than just its iconic landmarks; it’s about places like @osteriadeimeravigliaticanelli that weave history and innovation seamlessly. Elena Romano and Fabio Fassio’s visionary approach brought a fresh twist to this 19th-century gem.
Bunk beds, but not as you know them! Our Palace Gate project showcases how functional can be truly fabulous. It’s a playful yet sophisticated nod to childhood memories, elevated by our design touch.

Sometimes, elegance is in the simplicity. This space’s bright white wall, paired with a matching lamp, showcases monochromatic finesse. The result? A room that stands out, but in the most understated way.

Whenever I encounter the work of architects like William A. Mooser III, I’m reminded of the boundlesscreativity of the past. The mosaics and murals by Sargent Johnson at the Maritime Museum are a lesson in timeless design, speaking volumes about San Francisco’s rich architectural history.

Designing a space that’s both sophisticated and inviting is an intricate dance. Seeing @bradley.odom’s work here, I can’t help but admire the juxtapositions: bold colours, Brutalist furniture, and those lunette windows allowing the sun to grace the interiors. Not to mention the Cloud Chandelier by @apparatusstudio and the iconic fabric choice from @lamaisonpierrefrey.
The spiral staircase is more than just a pathway; it’s a statement, seamlessly weaving into the open living space and guiding eyes upwards in admiration.

It’s fascinating how one fabric, like this gem from @lamaisonpierrefrey, can transform entirely based on its environment. In this Singaporean family room, its allure is accentuated by the precise touch of @samuelandsons tape and the subtle play of the glossy taupe ceiling. It’s moments like these that inspire my design journey.
This bedside setup at Chelsea Barracks is a cosy embrace of warm hues, capturing the essence of an autumn evening. Every detail sings of the season’s rich, comforting palette.

Treated myself to a spooky little snack at @TheAnyaCafe. Yum. 

How is it November already!?

This month has been SUPER exciting. Finalising some beautiful residential projects that we will release in due course. I love showing insights into the behind the scenes of Atelier NM projects. A lot of our work is discretionary so it’s just such a treat to be able to share with you.

Diving deep into the details of design is where I find my joy. Just look at how the patterns and textures play together - it’s all about adding those personal touches to make a space truly feel like ‘you’. 

What’s your favourite detail in your home?

Thank you, thank you, thank you!!! SO happy and excited that we’ve been announced as the winners of the @SBIDawards for our Palace Gate Project in the category ‘Residential Apartment Over £1M’. As a huge admirer of the other design studios it was an honour to even be nominated.

Working with @ChatelaineInteriors was an absolute dream and seeing our work be recognised like this is mega.

Champagne is now on ice.

In a recent project, I’ve focused on achieving a harmonious blend of contrasting colours to add visual depth. The plush velvet chairs I selected introduce both texture and warmth, effortlessly complementing the room’s minimalist backdrop. I’ve grounded the design with wooden elements like the lamp stand and side table, ensuring every piece strikes a balance between form and function. It’s all in the details.

Shoutout to my incredible husband Karim, who recently gave an exclusive preview of this stunning Kensington property featured on @channel5. 

Karim and I, through @homeonesltd, offer a one-stop-shop service, seamlessly guiding clients from investment decisions to project delivery. That’s how we make dreams come true!

The careful placement of each artifact in my home, be it the unique vases or the intriguing framed pieces, serves as a testament to my belief in the power of eclectic design. It’s all about creating a conversation between objects, each echoing a piece of my journey.

In this award-winning (!!!) space, the headboard with its detailed print is my nod to classic design, but I kept it cool and modern with those sleek lines. I tossed in some coral pillows for a bit of contrast and warmth. I’m all for that easy-going elegance, a place that looks high-end without trying too hard. It’s about striking that balance where everything’s just right for some serious lounging.

Inside these walls, every design choice tells a chapter of my journey. This isn’t just design; it’s a personal narrative where I get to be not just a designer, but the storyteller of my own space. Welcome to a piece of my world. #Home

As autumn sweeps in and the air gets that familiar cool touch, this room is all about embracing warmth. From the deep burgundies to the playful patterns on the drapes, it’s like a design love letter to the season. Who else is feeling those fall vibes?

Getting lost in the details of this space, and I’m here for it. Those enchanting wall pieces, the textured couch vibes, and that hint of leopard. Always remember, your home is your canvas, and I absolutely adore blending textures and colours to bring it to life.

Hello, lovely people! Taking you on a quick tour of my Palace Gate project. Love the mix of crisp linens, earthy tones, and those patterned cushions. That wicker lamp and fabric headboard? Chosen for their texture and warmth. I always believe that your bedroom should be a peaceful oasis, and this design just resonates with calm energy. Sweet dreams are made here!

In this living room, I wanted to strike a balance between classic and contemporary. The greys and wood tones set a sophisticated stage, while the pop of green adds a playful twist. And the sculptural light fixture is my favourite part; it’s like a modern chandelier without the fuss. I’ve used textures and patterns to keep things interesting, from the rugs to the pillows. It’s a space that’s meant to feel curated
but comfortable, where every piece has its place.

This design moment really showcases the harmony of textures and the beauty of mixing materials. The purple veined marble-topped dressing table is a subtle but elegant addition to this master bedroom.

I just love the contrast here: the textured black stained timber with the brass trim against the cool marble. It’s these bespoke details that makes a space feel considered and full of life.

Looking at this space, I feel a spark of inspiration — it’s the essence of conviviality. The red here isn’t just a colour; it’s an invitation, a promise of warmth and lively interaction. It’s a design that speaks of shared stories and laughter over meals. This is the kind of energy I aim to capture in my work, where every element comes together to create a feeling of togetherness.

We wanted to capture a dynamic energy with a dash of sophistication for our clients dining space. The simplistic panelling and rattan feature provides the perfect base for some celestial art, adding a starry-eyed twist. We grounded the look with a solid wood console and those rich, emerald green chairs that just beg you to sink in.

It was all about creating a space that feels alive and engaging, with playful decor touches that spark curiosity and keep the eye moving.

Sun-drenched breakfasts come to life in this little nook of mine, where the light plays through these playful curtains and the palms outside sway to the rhythm of the city’s heartbeat. It’s my personal slice of paradise, vibrant and brimming with energy, where every sip of morning coffee is accompanied by a view that just doesn’t quit. Love starting my day here!

In this corner, I wanted to capture a sense of quiet luxury - essential for this Belgravia project. With their intricate embroidered detail, the curtains draw the eye without demanding attention. I’ve paired them with a sleek cabinet, its wood grain adding a subtle, organic pattern. The vase of wildflowers is a nod to nature’s artistry, providing a soft burst of life against the neutral palette.

The focus was on the texture and quality of the materials, used for balance & sophistication. We commissioned @kassavello to create two beautifully designed cabinets to feature in this dining space. Layering of materials, brass, timber grained for movement within the finish of the cabinets.

It’s a corner where simplicity and elegance coexist, each element chosen to create a moment of tranquility.

Are we bringing back tinsel trees? (say yes!!).

Love the maximalism of retro decorations. Let’s make it a ‘more is more’ kind of holiday this year. Who’s with me? #MaximalistChristmas

I wanted to blend textures and eras for a timeless look in this project. The marble fireplace anchors the room with its classic elegance, while the geometric relief wallpaper adds a contemporary edge. I’ve chosen accents like the spiky gold sconce and the shelf with eclectic objects to inject personality and depth. It’s a space where every piece comes together to create a sophisticated and welcoming vibe.

The festive atmosphere is a beautiful reminder of what truly sparks my creativity – the love and traditions that we share. Hope you’re all having a magical Christmas too. 

Sending you all peace and happiness.✨
